section.title: Create your first GWT application
section.para: The following is a description of the usage of the Google plug-in to create a new GWT application. plugin.

section.title: Project
section.para:
Select File > New > Web Application Project. Enter the name "de.vogella.gwt.helloworld" for your project and the java package. Only select "Use Google Web Toolkit", as we will not use the
Google App Engine in this tutorial.

para.tip:
Unfortunately the Google Plugin does not allow to create a new Web Application Project without creating template files. The template files are nice for the first try but annoying if you want to start from scratch with a new GWT application. Please stare / vote for bug
Issue 1547 to get this solved.

section.para: Delete all java files under the package "client" and "server".

section.title: Run
section.para: To run your application right-click the project and select Run As -> "Web application".
This opens a new view "Development Mode. Copy the url from this view.
Paste this url in your browser and install the required plug-in (is necessary).
